page.title: 13Life of Illston Farmer-cont
page.content: square and round baler, haymaking and silage equipment, a combine harvester, two muck spreaders, a forage feeder, a plough and cultivator disks. Conservation also plays a part in his role as a farmer. He has made and looks after a duck pond and has planted oak, fir and ash trees to enhance the countryside on his farm. He tries to use natural fertilizers and ploughs in the manure and straw bedding from his cows. The soil is also dressed with phosphate, potash and lime. The cultivated land is worked on a 3-4 year rotation. The small farm is a very interesting place with so many different activities but the craft of the independent farmer seems to be a dying one.
